8964eae7-d869-41b6-af84-085c4119e645.name: Assyafaah Mosque
8964eae7-d869-41b6-af84-085c4119e645.remarks: This mosque is the fifth one to be built under Phase III of the Mosque Building Fund programme to serve the needs of the Muslim community in the Northern part of Singapore. It also acts as a replacement due to the closure of two old mosques in the Sembawang area - Jumah Sembawang Mosque and Naval Base Mosque. The mosque which can accommodate about 4,000 people at one time was opened to the public on 9th April 2004.

9b35e834-00d1-492a-a792-54c9ea07beee.directions: 3rd level staircase landing, behind one of the older lecture theatres.
9b35e834-00d1-492a-a792-54c9ea07beee.name: Serangoon Junior College

30ff9dbc-82d9-4c35-ace9-4fbc48ec529d.name: Ahmad Mosque
30ff9dbc-82d9-4c35-ace9-4fbc48ec529d.remarks: Originally a typical kampung mosque built in 1934 on a piece of land given by a Mr Ahmat Yahya, the mosque has been redeveloped with better facilities.   Located in the Central part of the island, the masjid serves the residents and workers around the area

b3f32310-abfb-4c5c-8704-a2e14f5fad1e.name: Jamae Chulia Mosque
b3f32310-abfb-4c5c-8704-a2e14f5fad1e.remarks: The masjid was a contribution by the Chulian community. Built in 1826, it has gone through several places of renovation and expansion. The building bears the imprint of South Indian architecture in its narrow frontages, which are defined by minaret-style towers. Located in the Central part of the island, it serves office workers and has a capacity of 1500 people. It is one of the few masjids in Singapore, which organizes religious classes in Tamil.

683f61a9-4dbe-4445-a3c2-1006da17c713.name: Al-Ansar Mosque
683f61a9-4dbe-4445-a3c2-1006da17c713.remarks: Al-Ansar with its prominent tower minaret is among the first few masjids built under the Phase One of the Mosque Building Fund. Completed in 1981, the masjid located in the East can fill up to 3000 people at any one time. Located in the heart of the densely populated Bedok housing estate, the masjid offers madrasah classes. It is also one of the few masjids, which organizes religious classes in Tamil and one of the only two masjids with a full-time welfare officer.

7cdbb1df-a60d-4e61-bf5f-a78b0778cadf.directions: EA Engineering - Proceed to Level 7 staircase landing near Dean's Office.
7cdbb1df-a60d-4e61-bf5f-a78b0778cadf.name: EA Engineering, NUS

073aa964-102f-4671-9821-c61ccec42070.directions: There is a small office space at a corner for prayer. For direction, enquire Muslim staff.
073aa964-102f-4671-9821-c61ccec42070.name: Sakura Restaurant

7abb6bdc-1df2-4534-9e90-0ab56b75ad18.name: Nanyang Polytechnic, Blk N
7abb6bdc-1df2-4534-9e90-0ab56b75ad18.provision: Prayer Mat, Telekung, Sarong, Al-Quran, Slippers

c6875ab6-91b5-4983-9c10-5f9d61885b55.directions: Located just beside Battlestar Galactica. There is a small room for prayer stated "Prayer Room" with ablution facility provided
c6875ab6-91b5-4983-9c10-5f9d61885b55.name: Universal Studios Singapore

10c51bad-d498-4c8d-8ed5-fdae600f4829.directions: Take the lift to level 7 carpark. Out the door (no. 7), turn left and walk straight to the end of carpark (near iSetan sign), near carpark no. 123 & no. 124. Take the pathway near the trubines and it will lead to a "Fire Exit/Staircase 2" door. Open the door to the staircase landing. Musolla is located inside.
10c51bad-d498-4c8d-8ed5-fdae600f4829.name: Wisma Atria Shopping Centre
10c51bad-d498-4c8d-8ed5-fdae600f4829.provision: Slippers, Telekung, Prayer Mat, Al-Quran, Fan, Standing separator, Sarong, Chair
10c51bad-d498-4c8d-8ed5-fdae600f4829.remarks: There is also a small white ceramic basin outside the musolla for ablution. Shared male and female praying area.

5b5a6a21-d2d3-4755-bf73-18b824e78118.directions: Prayer room is for their staff but customers may ask permission to use it
5b5a6a21-d2d3-4755-bf73-18b824e78118.name: SPIZE at Bedok

311fcabc-5709-44b9-a044-4b03d03e33c0.name: Al-Amin Mosque
311fcabc-5709-44b9-a044-4b03d03e33c0.remarks: Inspired by Sumatran Minang architecture, this masjid with its brown structure stands out from the high-rise housing estate in Telok Blangah. Located at the Central District, it was built in 1991 with resources from the Mosque Building Fund. With a capacity of 3000, the masjid offers weekend madrasah and weekday classes to a total of 600 children. Islamic knowledge classes are also held during the evening.

6884ccfd-9be9-4165-855b-4bfb01dba9c9.address: 10 Kent Ridge Crescent, Faculty of Arts and Social Sciences (S), 119260
6884ccfd-9be9-4165-855b-4bfb01dba9c9.directions: FASS AS4 "Deck" Canteen - From Muslim Stall1, walk straight, turn left and enter the door next to the handicapped toilet. Walk straight, on your left is "Centre of Language Studies". Turn right and enter the door (near to female toilet) to lift. Go to level 6. Turn right; enter the door to staircase A.
6884ccfd-9be9-4165-855b-4bfb01dba9c9.name: AS4 Arts and Social Science, NUS

b714f4e1-06d6-4b4a-98a4-5d86f87b2f3c.address: 2 Hillside Drive Upper Serangoon Road, S(548920)
b714f4e1-06d6-4b4a-98a4-5d86f87b2f3c.name: Haji Yusoff Mosque

362c38a7-be18-4e1d-b534-999f2ecdb58e.directions: From the entrance, walk straight past the Straits Kitchen and lift lobby into the carpark. Once past the carpark entrance, turn right and look for door that states 'Prayer Room'.
362c38a7-be18-4e1d-b534-999f2ecdb58e.name: Grand Hyatt Hotel
362c38a7-be18-4e1d-b534-999f2ecdb58e.provision: Prayer Mat, Sarong, Sejadah, Songkok, Telekung, Attar, Tasbih, Al-Quran, Mirror, Chair, Slippers
362c38a7-be18-4e1d-b534-999f2ecdb58e.remarks: Strictly for staffs/tenants. Male and female praying area are segregated by a sliding curtain.

842b4871-72f9-43e7-9e4d-320d58bcea8c.name: Darul Ghufran Mosque
842b4871-72f9-43e7-9e4d-320d58bcea8c.remarks: The brick-clad wall panels which blend with the nearby sports facilities have given way to a bluish tile after an extensive and major repair work was carried out in 1999. Built under the Mosque Building Fund in 1991, the masjid sited next to busy Tampines Central in the East can accommodate up to 4,500 people. It has daily kindergarten and madrasah classes. In the evening, the masjid is a bustle of activities as men and women attend the various religious classes offered

e1d61299-8b36-4697-96c2-887f8a602fae.name: En-Naeem Mosque
e1d61299-8b36-4697-96c2-887f8a602fae.remarks: Built under Phase Two of the Mosque Building Fund, the masjid located at the junction of Tampines Road and Hougang Ave 3, with its box-like structure and tall minaret stands out prominently, next to high-rise residential flats. Built in 1983, it serves the religious needs of residents in surrounding Hougang areas.

25dc62cf-5b4a-4c64-8b3e-abd7263edfb1.name: Omar Salmah Mosque
25dc62cf-5b4a-4c64-8b3e-abd7263edfb1.remarks: At one glance, it looked like any other kampung house which is slowly becoming a rare sight in a city of concrete jungle. This old generation masjid built in 1973 can accommodate up to 300 worshippers. The rather isolated masjid in the Central zone and presently caters to Television Corporation of Singapore staff nearby. Its activities include korban, Eid and Friday prayers.

5e304bba-6586-4311-b587-9705d71dc3e6.directions: Basement carpark, underneath escalator near parking lot number 250. Look out for greyish door that states 'Male's Prayer Room' or 'Female's Prayer Room'.
5e304bba-6586-4311-b587-9705d71dc3e6.name: IKEA Alexandra
5e304bba-6586-4311-b587-9705d71dc3e6.provision: Slippers, Al-Quran, Prayer mat, Chair, Fan, Tasbih, Sarong, Telekung
5e304bba-6586-4311-b587-9705d71dc3e6.remarks: There is an ablution area in the musolla. Musolla is air-conditioned. Segregated male and female praying area.

10f4dac8-5636-4b90-945f-2065160404f5.directions: Find toilet. After toilet, turn right to loading bay. Walk pass emergency eyewash. Enter 'hallway'. There's a partition. That's the solat place.
10f4dac8-5636-4b90-945f-2065160404f5.name: Pasir Ris Swimming Complex
10f4dac8-5636-4b90-945f-2065160404f5.remarks: Please take wuduk at toilet first. Can't remember if there's telekung for ladies.

ebf8111d-807b-41f2-95e6-50bb909ed99c.name: Burhani Mosque
ebf8111d-807b-41f2-95e6-50bb909ed99c.remarks: Sandwiched between high-rise buildings, this old generation masjid was established by the Dawoodi Bohra community in Singapore as early as 1829. Conveniently located in the Central district, it can accommodate up to 150 people. It is also frequented by office workers in the Hill Street and High Street areas.

8882f6a1-cf5a-4315-abc2-aed4d01e0746.name: Al-Mawaddah Mosque
8882f6a1-cf5a-4315-abc2-aed4d01e0746.remarks: This Phase 4 mosque was built to cater to the large demographic of young families in the Buangkok and Sengkang area. Aside from it's numerous family friendly features for the young and the old, it also boasts a number of environmentally-friendly features that are energy-conserving. Due to this mosque has attained the Greenmark Certification from the Building and Construction Authority.

d4e4a3a6-12c4-4da2-979a-45d25198b1fa.directions: Departure Transit: Lounge South, behind Mont Blanc.
d4e4a3a6-12c4-4da2-979a-45d25198b1fa.name: Changi Airport Terminal 3

33806974-5d3f-40d5-9f47-12e2ec59e8fe.name: Muhajirin Mosque
33806974-5d3f-40d5-9f47-12e2ec59e8fe.remarks:
The masjid has been re-built as part of the Singapore Islamic Hub development and was opened to public in January 2009.  

Masjid Muhajirin is the first masjid to be built under the Mosque Building Fund. Back then it was easily recognizable by its prominent dome and minaret at the entrance of the building.  Sited next to the Islamic Centre of the Islamic Religious Council of Singapore, it was completed in April 1977 with a capacity of 1400 people and serves Muslims of all ages living in Toa Payoh and Bishan.

3b549f23-8963-4669-91c5-a6a7b08a0d1a.directions: E3 Engineering - Proceed to Level 6 staircase landing near male toilet.
3b549f23-8963-4669-91c5-a6a7b08a0d1a.name: E3 Engineering, NUS

f745a58d-28b1-4bfd-9195-330588036c05.directions:
Take lift to either Level 7 or Level R.
Musollah located at the top of each staircase within the building.
Segregated by gender.
f745a58d-28b1-4bfd-9195-330588036c05.name: SIT@NYP
f745a58d-28b1-4bfd-9195-330588036c05.remarks:
Level R (Top Floor), Stairs 1 - Muslimin
Level R (Top Floor), Stairs 3 - Muslimah
Level 7, Stairs 2 - Muslimah

To take ablution in nearest toilet. (Level 7)

1516c631-2d37-4045-9fe0-d37e5494d5d0.directions: Take lift from main lobby to Basement 1 and turn right. Enter exit door (to carpark B1) and turn right towards carpark. Turn left and there is a small prayer place located at the extreme end.
1516c631-2d37-4045-9fe0-d37e5494d5d0.name: Suntec City/Millenia Walk
1516c631-2d37-4045-9fe0-d37e5494d5d0.remarks: Ablution place is provided outside the room

a1870d7d-7eda-4f4f-bf69-f5af22967b95.directions: Women's Wing, at the staircase landing beside 24hr clinic (behind Exit door).
a1870d7d-7eda-4f4f-bf69-f5af22967b95.name: KK Women's and Children's Hospital

c9ea9723-df34-4e56-b71f-26bec0e2b41a.directions: Enter straircase 2 located beside unit #03-09. Enter another door (any one). Musolla is located under the staircase.
c9ea9723-df34-4e56-b71f-26bec0e2b41a.name: Adelphi
c9ea9723-df34-4e56-b71f-26bec0e2b41a.remarks: Shared male and female praying area.

a7566046-15b1-4153-9507-0214264bd6a1.name: Bencoolen Mosque
a7566046-15b1-4153-9507-0214264bd6a1.remarks: This masjid was originally built in 1845. In 2001, the mosque's site was redeveloped as part of a mixed development comprising of a commercial block and a 12-storey residential complex. The redeveloped masjid, which is part of the complex, was opened to the public in May 2004. It can accommodate about 1,100 worshippers.

303dc6de-5a04-4f0b-a288-df85ac7cdf23.directions: E5 Engineering - Proceed to Level 4 staircase landing near elevator on E5 side.
303dc6de-5a04-4f0b-a288-df85ac7cdf23.name: E5 Engineering, NUS

1d3cdfab-0890-408c-b703-714a6f7c763a.name: Sallim Mattar Mosque
1d3cdfab-0890-408c-b703-714a6f7c763a.remarks: Built during colonial times, this old generation masjid has been gazetted as a national monument. Built in 1824, it was one of the first few masjids to be built on the island. It was later rebuilt in 1920 by Swan and Maclaren who were responsible for Singapore’s other important landmarks. The masjid is a mix of Classical, Persian, Moorish and Turkish themes that form what is known as the Islamic Saracenic style. Located in the Central, it has a capacity of 2000 people and is one of the most frequented prayer venue.

4e03f25d-877e-4bef-829f-997c72968fd9.directions: Take the lift to level 10, walk straight (about 50 metres) and turn left.
4e03f25d-877e-4bef-829f-997c72968fd9.name: Lucky Plaza

images.caption: Ablution in toilet Near The Musholla

82650886-7c86-4575-b182-830e36d5792c.directions: Convention Centre (B1, near the lift & staircase)
82650886-7c86-4575-b182-830e36d5792c.name: Ngee Ann Polytechnic, Convention Centre

d4be16b0-2540-448e-972a-6432fa672568.name: Nanyang Polytechnic, Blk C
d4be16b0-2540-448e-972a-6432fa672568.provision: Prayer Mat, Telekung, Sarong, Al-Quran, Slippers

7a44b110-d078-432e-b37e-b1374a75c5e2.directions: Take the staircase to level 2. Male's praying area is at level2, for female take another staircase beside ablution area
7a44b110-d078-432e-b37e-b1374a75c5e2.name: Darul Arqam
7a44b110-d078-432e-b37e-b1374a75c5e2.provision: Prayer Mat, Telekung, Sarong, Songkok, Perfume, Mirror
7a44b110-d078-432e-b37e-b1374a75c5e2.remarks: Segregated male and female praying area. Ablution place is provided.

0915da42-48d8-4dd0-b343-dd3d00192808.address: 11 Lim Chu Kang Road, Muslim Cemetary, S(719452)
0915da42-48d8-4dd0-b343-dd3d00192808.name: Pusara Aman Mosque

707522c6-ab2d-413f-a989-9c05529d7c25.name: Al-Istiqamah Mosque
707522c6-ab2d-413f-a989-9c05529d7c25.remarks: At one glance, the masjid blends the architectural flavours of buildings in the Middle East, Nusantra and Mauritius. Its cream and turquoise-green structure stands proudly amidst the housing estate in Serangoon. One of the newest masjids under the Mosque Building Fund, it was completed in May 1999 and can accommodate up to 3300 people at any given time. Located in the Northeast, it is dubbed the multimedia masjid for its IT facilities.

0c9c34d8-66ab-414a-9d3b-fb9770d48257.name: Nanyang Polytechnic, Blk S
0c9c34d8-66ab-414a-9d3b-fb9770d48257.provision: Prayer Mat, Telekung, Sarong, Al-Quran, Slippers

fe6c8f28-90d8-4c02-931e-200af7141b5a.name: Khalid Mosque
fe6c8f28-90d8-4c02-931e-200af7141b5a.remarks: First built in 1917, this old generation masjid underwent several restorations, the most recent one in 1998. Located in the Central part of the island, its newly-restored building which comes complete with a minaret at the front porch can fill up to 2500 people. Ramadan is a busy month for the mosque as an average of 800 Muslims break their fast at the mosque daily. There are regular religious classes for children and adults.

ebc063d2-2fb3-4319-a0a8-3bdd58e44e9a.directions: Head to the end of the Asli Village Halal Foodcourt. Musolla is located near Pizza Hut, directly behind Lotus Secret Bun.
ebc063d2-2fb3-4319-a0a8-3bdd58e44e9a.name: Downtown East
ebc063d2-2fb3-4319-a0a8-3bdd58e44e9a.remarks: Ablution area is located behind the musolla. Segregated male and female praying area.

9f259807-283c-46d5-a06a-7b57ff3f32fd.name: Ahmad Ibrahim Mosque
9f259807-283c-46d5-a06a-7b57ff3f32fd.remarks: Built in 1958, this old generation zinc-roofed mosque located in the North part of the island serves the religious needs of Muslim living and working in the vicinity. It can accommodate 200 Muslims at any one time. It offers nursery, kindergarten and weekend madrasah classes for children of nearby residents. Altogether, a total of 480 children attend classes at various times, at the masjid. Since the ‘70s, there have been several renovation and repair works carried out.

39f26f71-0d11-4cc2-82cb-ca2c1993c5f2.directions: At the basement carpark, find the signage that states staircase L. Turn right and you will see the prayer rooms.
39f26f71-0d11-4cc2-82cb-ca2c1993c5f2.name: Big Box
39f26f71-0d11-4cc2-82cb-ca2c1993c5f2.remarks: Female prayer room might be locked. Ablution place is provided.

ac87d5ea-e43d-48eb-8181-00fb4248cd51.name: Wak Tanjong Mosque
ac87d5ea-e43d-48eb-8181-00fb4248cd51.remarks: A whitewashed structure has replaced the semi-wooden prayer hall in this redeveloped masjid located in the Central part of the island. The original masjid dated back to the year 1935. In 1998, the masjid was reopened after undergoing a major restructuring. It has a capacity of 500 people.

cc4e296b-b6ed-42ad-aa44-0396c0c40972.name: Omar Kg Melaka Mosque
cc4e296b-b6ed-42ad-aa44-0396c0c40972.remarks: The oldest masjid in Singapore, it has humble beginnings as a wooden surau way back in 1820. Monetary contributions from wealthy merchant Syed Abdullah bin Omar Aljunied made possible its rebuilding in 1855. The old generation masjid located in the Central, underwent yet another major rebuilding project several years ago in which a tall minaret with a small roof dome is added at the entrance of the mosque. With a capacity of 500 people, it is the focal point for office workers during daily and Friday prayers

8f6805a9-8bc3-4e26-9c28-d01f9392cf69.address: 4 Architecture Drive, School of Design & Environment (S), 117566
8f6805a9-8bc3-4e26-9c28-d01f9392cf69.directions: Architecture (SDE3) - Alight from SDE bus stop. Walk towards Centre For English Language Communication building. Pass it and keep walking along the pavement until you pass a bookshop on your left. Walk straight and turn right, take the lift and go to level 4. Turn right, walk pass the lecture room and turn right when you see staircase, go up and turn left. Female toilet is opposite LR422. Male toilet is opposite LR427. Musolla is at the staircase landing near to the female toilet.
8f6805a9-8bc3-4e26-9c28-d01f9392cf69.name: SDE3 Design and Environment, NUS

79b51ceb-884f-4ab7-b206-d8199163bfc3.name: Darul Aman Mosque
79b51ceb-884f-4ab7-b206-d8199163bfc3.remarks: A squarish minaret in this Mosque Building Fund masjid combines Malay architecture and Islamic art. Nominated for the prestigious Aga Khan Award in 1989 as an excellent example of tropical architecture, the masjid features the early pitched-roof structure commonly found in the Malay archipelago. Built in 1986, the masjid located in the East can accommodate up to 3,500 people. Besides madrasah classes, it is also popular venue for haj courses organized by travel agents. The masjid has since undergone a major addition and alteration project which was completed in 2005.

046236a0-b77a-4c81-895e-f8381b648159.name: Al-Huda Mosque
046236a0-b77a-4c81-895e-f8381b648159.remarks: In the past, this old generation masjid served the needs of residents living in the Malay kampung near Sixth Avenue, Bukit Timah. With resettlement, the masjid located in the Central area now serves the workers in Bukit Timah area and some residents nearby. Built in 1966, the masjid, which can accommodate up to 400 people, has undergone several renovations. Its activities are confined to daily and Friday prayers as well as celebrations of Islamic festivities.

e928dcf3-883f-45db-b391-47971f702142.name: Petempatan Melayu Sembawang Mosque
e928dcf3-883f-45db-b391-47971f702142.remarks: Surrounded by lush greeneries and a reasonably huge compound, there is an air of serenity at this old generation masjid built in 1970. Located in the North and away from busy streets, it offers weekend madrasah classes as well as religious classes on a weekly basis. It has a capacity of 300 people.

43c95d07-1993-4d27-a78c-23bf65f9aab2.directions: Take lift lobby A beside McDonald's. At level 4, follow the signboards
43c95d07-1993-4d27-a78c-23bf65f9aab2.name: IMM Building
43c95d07-1993-4d27-a78c-23bf65f9aab2.provision: Slippers, Prayer Mat, Sarong, Tasbih, Al-Quran, Telekung, Fan, Chair, Water Dipper
43c95d07-1993-4d27-a78c-23bf65f9aab2.remarks: Segregated praying area for male and female. Ablution area is beside the toilet (outside musolla). Keys to ablution area can be taken from the musolla. Return the key after use.

801fe031-ae33-4e16-a2d5-f55a0d292c55.directions: Proceed to level 1 library entrance and enter the exit door on the left. Walk to the end for female area. For male, take the staircase inside to level 2.
801fe031-ae33-4e16-a2d5-f55a0d292c55.name: Civic Centre
801fe031-ae33-4e16-a2d5-f55a0d292c55.remarks: Not an official praying area. Shared male & female area.

5469a4ff-900c-4c82-a305-77952588b945.name: An-Nur Mosque
5469a4ff-900c-4c82-a305-77952588b945.remarks: Located in the North part of the island, An-Nur is more than just a landmark in Woodlands. The masjid has created a name for its outreach programme and grassroots activities through its Qaryah (outreach) initiatives. It is also one of the masjids, which provide strong support for the kidney donation campaign. Built in 1980 under the Mosque Building fund, An-Nur can accommodate up to 2800 worshippers. There are madrasah and kindergarten classes offered at the masjid to children of the neighbouring estate

e76be0fa-4356-4d0f-a72f-b29d1a79b19c.directions: Go past the toilet beside Giordano and turn left into the lift lobby
e76be0fa-4356-4d0f-a72f-b29d1a79b19c.name: Causeway Point

adbce676-a31e-48e5-a231-03df20bc6430.name: Kampong Delta Mosque
adbce676-a31e-48e5-a231-03df20bc6430.remarks: Tucked away among Housing Board skyscraper flats, this redeveloped masjid was built on the old site of surau Delta which was first built in 1960. The new two-storey building was completed in 1995 increasing its capacity to 500 people. Its main activities are confined to daily and Friday prayers as well as celebrations of Maulid and other religious occasions.

cb94171b-7be0-4ef3-8d1f-33e1a1d42755.name: Al-Mukminin Mosque
cb94171b-7be0-4ef3-8d1f-33e1a1d42755.remarks: The masjid, financed by the Mosque Building Fund, was originally completed in 1987.  Located in the West, it has since undergone a major upgrading from a 2-storey to a 4-storey with basement building, which was completed in June 2006 and can now accommodate a congregation of about 4,500.  It offers a range of Islamic Learning programmes serving the needs of the residents in the nearby HDB estates .

9552b56a-fb47-49b7-9bc7-39f6431da83d.directions: Near the toilet and cargo lift number 3. Enter the exit door (Staircase D). Turn right and proceed to the end.
9552b56a-fb47-49b7-9bc7-39f6431da83d.name: Queensway Shopping Centre
9552b56a-fb47-49b7-9bc7-39f6431da83d.remarks: Shared area for male and female. Ablution area beside the praying area. No fan or aircon.

227b79db-6657-462f-8c1a-ee2934fccc28.address: S16 Science Drive 2, Faculty of Science 6 (S), 117546
227b79db-6657-462f-8c1a-ee2934fccc28.directions: S15 Science - Alight at the Science bus stop. Walk towards S16. Turn to the left and walk towards S15. Take the lift to the 6th floor. Climb the stairs to the musolla.
227b79db-6657-462f-8c1a-ee2934fccc28.name: S15 Science, NUS

c10ef04b-5903-46c7-badf-19d30ac5a23a.directions: From hotel entrance, walk straight and turn right to the male and female toilets next to the lift lobby. There will be signs that lead to the musolla (surau). Go upstairs to the carpark. Turn left before the entrance to the carpark (enter the door that states 'surau').
c10ef04b-5903-46c7-badf-19d30ac5a23a.name: Royal Plaza on Scotts
c10ef04b-5903-46c7-badf-19d30ac5a23a.provision: Prayer Mat, Telekung, Al-Quran, Tasbih, Chair, Slippers, Attar
c10ef04b-5903-46c7-badf-19d30ac5a23a.remarks: There is an ablution area in the musolla. Male and female praying area are segregated by a sliding wall.

7948f21b-0fc8-474e-84b9-5260ca6ff8e2.directions: Arrival Transit: Below Gate Holdroom C1 at Arrival West.
7948f21b-0fc8-474e-84b9-5260ca6ff8e2.name: Changi Airport Terminal 1

8f0bc2cd-2c22-489b-8376-583fda0039a5.name: Nanyang Polytechnic, Blk H
8f0bc2cd-2c22-489b-8376-583fda0039a5.provision: Prayer Mat, Telekung, Sarong, Al-Quran, Slippers

7061ca46-80b2-45a7-ad2b-48829003df89.name: Nanyang Polytechnic, Blk E
7061ca46-80b2-45a7-ad2b-48829003df89.provision: Prayer Mat, Telekung, Sarong, Al-Quran, Slippers

cbd71d16-b68f-463a-812c-83a5359882f0.directions: Located at the Ranger Station which is nearby Amara Sanctuary Resort and Tourism Academy. It is just along the road towards the Beach Station. Ask the ranger on duty to direct the way to the praying room.
cbd71d16-b68f-463a-812c-83a5359882f0.name: Sentosa Island, Ranger Station

7e07b4f9-1098-4732-9272-d3fec9c56e20.directions: B1, Beach Station yellow zone carpark. Take the escalator opposite the information counter to the basement carpark. Turn right and there is a separate room for male & female with a sign stated "Prayer Room". Ablution can be taken at the nearby water point just to the right of the musolla.
7e07b4f9-1098-4732-9272-d3fec9c56e20.name: Sentosa Island, Beach Station

232e59e9-8522-4c04-8617-4c611f5acbe7.name: Al-Abdul Razak Mosque
232e59e9-8522-4c04-8617-4c611f5acbe7.remarks: Nested amidst the private house of the well-to-do Malays in the East, this old generation masjid was built in 1965. The masjid with a capacity of 300, underwent minor renovations in 1997 to include additional facilities. It has a full-time imam (religious teacher) and noja (masjid helper). Religious classes are held on an ad-hoc basis. There are religious classes for the ladies every Thursday evening. Classes for the men are held every Friday evening.  Currently, major upgrading works are currently being done on the mosque.

fa9c53eb-a8c3-4984-96f9-b28af296a034.address: MD3 Medical Drive, Saw Swee Hock School of Public Health 16 (S), 117597
fa9c53eb-a8c3-4984-96f9-b28af296a034.directions: MD3 Medicine - Alight at the Science bus stop. Walk towards the canteen. Climb the stairs towards LT25. Walk towards Starbucks. Stop at MD3 and turn to the left. Walk towards the photocopy shop. Turn to the left and walk towards the lift. Take the lift to level 6. Climb the stairs to the musolla.
fa9c53eb-a8c3-4984-96f9-b28af296a034.name: MD3 Medicine, NUS

a47c10e2-6863-4606-8372-5978ad38f397.directions: Head towards level 3 lift lobby, turn right down the hallway. Musolla is located in rooms with sliding doors
a47c10e2-6863-4606-8372-5978ad38f397.name: Tampines Mall
a47c10e2-6863-4606-8372-5978ad38f397.remarks: Segregated male and female praying area.

4db6cbe7-273a-4d8f-b9fd-16b1555ef49a.name: Hajjah Fatimah Mosque
4db6cbe7-273a-4d8f-b9fd-16b1555ef49a.remarks: This is another old generation masjid built from donation from a wealthy lady named Fatimah. Located in the Central district, it was completed in 1846. the masjid bears the imprint of colonial architect J T Thomson, is a charming blend of local and European architecture. It is today one of Singapore’s national monuments. Extensive renovation work was carried out several years ago in which its leaning minaret was righted. The masjid, which can accommodate up to 600 people offers religious lectures on an ad-hoc basis. It is particularly popular among office workers in Jalan Sultan area

f767f531-c7bc-432c-9c95-192687c9ca35.directions: Departure Transit: Lounge North, near gate E, behind Aido.
f767f531-c7bc-432c-9c95-192687c9ca35.name: Changi Airport Terminal 2

10d70a8f-983d-4ff9-8e3c-993a4bb7e9c3.address: 10 Kent Ridge Crescent, Faculty of Arts and Social Sciences (S), 119260
10d70a8f-983d-4ff9-8e3c-993a4bb7e9c3.directions: AS6 FASS - Alight at the Central Library bus stop. Climb the stairs to the library. Turn to the right and walk down the walkway towards AS6. Turn to the left and enter AS6 glass door. Walk all the way to the exit door at the opposite end. Take the lift to level 5. Exit through the exit door to the staircase landing.
10d70a8f-983d-4ff9-8e3c-993a4bb7e9c3.name: AS6 Arts and Social Science, NUS

e4c890ba-4299-4671-87f4-ff26ef71321d.name: Ar-Raudhah Mosque
e4c890ba-4299-4671-87f4-ff26ef71321d.remarks: The masjid prides itself for having an extensive library of Islamic literatures. Built in 1993, it is located in the West and is one of the pioneer masjids offering computer facilities to Muslims. It can accommodate up to 3,000 worshippers. The masjid built under the Mosque Building Fund also has complete jenazah (death ritual) services, which is rare among the other mosques. One of its strength is its family development unit, which offers assistance in cash and kind to needy families, single parents as well as kidney patients.

ae944dc4-5ac5-40fe-bbc5-d74d4a136bd0.address: Pulau Bukom, P O Box 1908, S(903808)
ae944dc4-5ac5-40fe-bbc5-d74d4a136bd0.name: Pulau Bukom Mosque

78452ab4-009b-4ef4-958b-cb74c16f71be.directions: Beside Quest Salon #02-27. Go straight between WAREHOUSE and BCBGMAXAZRIA.
78452ab4-009b-4ef4-958b-cb74c16f71be.name: Raffles City Shopping Centre
78452ab4-009b-4ef4-958b-cb74c16f71be.provision: Prayer Mat, Telekung, Slippers, Tasbih, Al-Quran, Sarong, Songkok, Telekung
78452ab4-009b-4ef4-958b-cb74c16f71be.remarks: Segregated male and female praying area. Can also be accessed from Swissotel The Stamford Hotel.

d1fa8eab-21b9-432e-ba93-6e9b03c76f1e.directions: Take the staircase/elevator up to level 2. The staircase is located at the entrance to Hall 6 from level 2. (There is a door with a musolla sign to the staircase.)
d1fa8eab-21b9-432e-ba93-6e9b03c76f1e.name: Singapore Expo, Hall 6
d1fa8eab-21b9-432e-ba93-6e9b03c76f1e.provision: Telekung, Stool, Prayer Mat, Songkok, Sewing Kit, Mirror, Fan, Slippers
d1fa8eab-21b9-432e-ba93-6e9b03c76f1e.remarks: Segregated male and female praying area.

f8ccc11e-65aa-4fcf-b2b1-614d276b6630.directions: Head to the lift lobby on level 4, nect to Kid@Play waterpark. The lift lobby is right beside the washroom. Enter the staircase landing in front of the cargo lifts. Musolla is on the top floor.
f8ccc11e-65aa-4fcf-b2b1-614d276b6630.name: Northpoint
f8ccc11e-65aa-4fcf-b2b1-614d276b6630.remarks: Not an official praying area. Shared male & female area. Provision found in the hosereel cabinet.

d263595e-163b-4ea5-8847-22bfce7f1492.name: Malabar Mosque
d263595e-163b-4ea5-8847-22bfce7f1492.remarks: One can hardly miss this blue-tiled building adorned with gold-coloured domes located at the junction of Victoria Street and Jalan Sultan. This redeveloped masjid was first built in 1918. in 1962, it underwent major rebuilding into what it is today. Located in the Central part of the island, it serves the needs of office workers around the area and has a capacity of 1000 people. Besides religious classes, it organizes zikir sessions.

1deeb9b0-ba6f-41ba-81c1-0fb1e87ee001.directions: Enter 1Market and proceed to the entrance near the toilet. The musolla is covered by a sliding curtain. If unsure, you may ask the staff there.
1deeb9b0-ba6f-41ba-81c1-0fb1e87ee001.name: 1Market at Plaza Singapura
1deeb9b0-ba6f-41ba-81c1-0fb1e87ee001.remarks: Only available to 1Market customers. Shared male and female praying area. Area may be closed if the reataurant is too crowded.

03e42983-a5c4-4e8e-a28e-cc0fa43dbb56.directions: Walk to Multi Purpose Hall, Musollah is behind the stage of multi purpose Hall.
03e42983-a5c4-4e8e-a28e-cc0fa43dbb56.name: PSB Academy

bd574847-11da-412b-810b-e5f650f8a7ba.directions: Proceed to level 4 and find the staircase beside the library
bd574847-11da-412b-810b-e5f650f8a7ba.name: Lot One
bd574847-11da-412b-810b-e5f650f8a7ba.remarks: Shared male and female praying area. Not an official praying area.

25bb0b8b-0fc0-4fc2-a6f9-d7c2bfbb6357.directions: From NTUC xtra, walk towards the toilet beside it. The location is at the fire exit before the toilet.
25bb0b8b-0fc0-4fc2-a6f9-d7c2bfbb6357.name: Kallang Wave Mall
25bb0b8b-0fc0-4fc2-a6f9-d7c2bfbb6357.provision: Prayer Mat, Telekung, Slippers Provided For.
25bb0b8b-0fc0-4fc2-a6f9-d7c2bfbb6357.remarks: The area is a long corridor, so if you bring your own prayer mat, you can pray there too.

images.caption: One Long Stretch Of Solah Area

5a59c0ad-4475-41a1-ba70-2fb035f25a9b.name: Tentera Di Raja Mosque
5a59c0ad-4475-41a1-ba70-2fb035f25a9b.remarks: Built in 1961 by Muslim members of the British army, this old generation masjid was renamed Tentera Di Raja in recognition of their contributions. Located in the West and close to the National University of Singapore, it is distinguished by its minaret topped by a gold-painted dome. With a capacity of 1000 people, its newly-set up Youth Wing whose members are mostly undergraduates has recently embarked on a tuition scheme called EMAS (English, Maths and Science) for primary six children.

7469dec1-9dc2-435d-8851-b5ce03b63268.name: Al-Istighfar Mosque
7469dec1-9dc2-435d-8851-b5ce03b63268.remarks: This three-storey masjid is one of the most recent mosques built under Phase Three of the Mosque Building Fund. Completed in June 1999, it is located in the East, along Pasir Ris Drive 3. it can be recognized by its outstanding blue dome and modern yet Islamic architecture. The masjid, which can accommodate a congregation of 3300 people offers madrasah and kindergarten classes. It is a hive of activities during the evening when religious classes opened its doors to Muslims in the vicinity and also those living nearby.

c7623ffe-e628-4663-a50a-d47412fec80f.name: Al-Taqua Mosque
c7623ffe-e628-4663-a50a-d47412fec80f.remarks: In the ‘60s, this masjid was one of the important symbols for the villagers living in kampung around Bedok. Built in 1883, this single-storey masjid has gone several renovations. It now serves the handful residents living nearby as well as in the East. With a capacity of 400 worshippers, the masjid holds regular religious classes.

22ca913f-5a4d-4111-ac6e-b48afb5ecfaa.name: Nanyang Polytechnic, Blk Q
22ca913f-5a4d-4111-ac6e-b48afb5ecfaa.provision: Prayer Mat, Telekung, Sarong, Al-Quran, Slippers

360f7e82-be30-4a56-b19e-0c0aabf58a89.name: Assyakirin Mosque
360f7e82-be30-4a56-b19e-0c0aabf58a89.remarks: One of the oldest masjids under the Mosque Building Fund, the original masjid building was opened to the public in 1978. It served the religious needs of Muslims living in the West, specifically in the Jurong area. The masjid was rebuilt to maximize land usage in order to cater to the growing needs of the residents at the neighbourhood. It was reopened on 27 Dec 2002 and can accomodate 6000 worshippers, double the capacity of the older building.

af4660c2-804c-41ef-80ac-4683a2219d4c.directions: EA Engineering - Proceed to Level 7 staircase landing near cafe.
af4660c2-804c-41ef-80ac-4683a2219d4c.name: EA Engineering, NUS

6f7ca455-c755-4218-b085-64afc10fe98d.name: Kampung Siglap Mosque
6f7ca455-c755-4218-b085-64afc10fe98d.remarks: Architects responsible for the design of this masjid built under Phase Two of the Mosque Building Fund have succeeded in preserving the architecture and ambience of a kampung. Originally, a small 80-year-old masjid, the new masjid in the same site was completed in 1992. Located in the East, it has a capacity of 3000 people. Besides madrasah classes, there is a Tahfiz Al-Quran center. A Centre of Family Development provides guidance and courses to enhance family life.

bac9cb06-6886-4729-b6a0-ed18c917bb11.directions:
Located at staircase near lift, end of Spotlight outlet. Adjacent to the home furnishing section of Spotlight outlet. There's a room in between the staircase and the lifts.

Room is not entitled for prayers. However, prayers are allowed.

Wudu' to be taken at the washroom beside it.
bac9cb06-6886-4729-b6a0-ed18c917bb11.name: Plaza Singapura
bac9cb06-6886-4729-b6a0-ed18c917bb11.remarks: Bring own sejadah/praying mat. And telekung (for muslimah)

453eb561-e362-4d0e-9a25-c89f20b4a21e.name: Hang Jebat Mosque
453eb561-e362-4d0e-9a25-c89f20b4a21e.remarks: From a small surau, this old generation masjid has grown into what it is today. Built in 1952, this zinc-roofed masjid underwent major renovations in 1996 to expand on its prayer hall. Today it can accommodate 600 worshippers. Located in the Central part of the island, the masjid offers weekend madrasah classes to students living around Queenstown area. It also organizes zikir sessions where praises to Allah are recited.

7836b47e-f8b8-4e88-b92d-76e04b72c2ae.name: Jamek Queenstown Mosque
7836b47e-f8b8-4e88-b92d-76e04b72c2ae.remarks: Much of what was built in 1965 is retained today in this 35-year-old masjid. Located in the Central part of the island, this old generation masjid built in 1965 serves office workers around the area and has a capacity of 400 worshippers. Activities are confined to weekend madrasah classes as well as religious lectures on Thursday, Friday and Saturday.

60cb2846-d943-4b1f-9d2c-bfd5c0c5bc74.name: Nanyang Polytechnic, Blk L
60cb2846-d943-4b1f-9d2c-bfd5c0c5bc74.provision: Prayer Mat, Telekung, Sarong, Al-Quran, Slippers

941c63b1-20dd-407a-adeb-d6e8451d6572.name: Tasek Utara Mosque
941c63b1-20dd-407a-adeb-d6e8451d6572.remarks: In sharp contrast to a Saracenic style masjid or avant-garde looking religious structures, this old generation masjid is simple yet functional. Located at the junction of Bristol Road and Carlisle Road, this one-storey masjid can accommodate up to 120 people. Built in 1907 its main activities include daily and Friday prayers as well as occasional religious lectures.

67dc14c2-8cc4-48ed-a38b-32ee72ade045.directions: Level 4, near the toilet at extreme end of IKEA Restaurant & Café. There are signs to lead to the location.
67dc14c2-8cc4-48ed-a38b-32ee72ade045.name: IKEA Tampines
67dc14c2-8cc4-48ed-a38b-32ee72ade045.remarks: There is an ablution area in the musolla. Musolla is air-conditioned. Segregated male and female praying area.

eaac65c0-f3fa-4f97-9fb9-36e3901f9eca.directions: Enter the EXIT door at lift lobby level 5. Lift lobby is located between Seahorse and V.Hive.
eaac65c0-f3fa-4f97-9fb9-36e3901f9eca.name: Plaza Singapura
eaac65c0-f3fa-4f97-9fb9-36e3901f9eca.remarks: Not an official praying area. Shared male & female area. Provision found in the hosereel cabinet.

209e6912-5cd9-48fa-9b94-867a56083de8.address: S16 Science Drive 2, Faculty of Science 6 (S), 117546
209e6912-5cd9-48fa-9b94-867a56083de8.directions: S17 Department of Mathematics - Alight at the Science bus stop. Cross over to the department of Mathematics. Take the lift to the 4th floor. Exit the lift area, turn to the left and walk towards the Exit door. Enter the Exit door and climb the stairs to the musolla.
209e6912-5cd9-48fa-9b94-867a56083de8.name: S17 Science, NUS

2acf998e-0037-4757-a7f1-ca85143c5c6e.directions: Go down to basement 3 from the lift situated to the left of the taxi stand (outside the hotel lobby). Out the lift, turn right towards the carpark ramps. Before the carpark ramps, turn right and walk straight. Once you reach the end, turn left to the musolla.
2acf998e-0037-4757-a7f1-ca85143c5c6e.name: Orchard Hotel
2acf998e-0037-4757-a7f1-ca85143c5c6e.provision: Prayer Mat, Telekung, Tasbih, Fan, Chair, Al-Quran, Sarong, Songkok, Mirror
2acf998e-0037-4757-a7f1-ca85143c5c6e.remarks: There is also an ablution area outside musolla. Strictly for staffs/tenants. Male and female praying areas are segregated.

5be66a13-02bf-4cd3-bfd9-9dc04fb61e50.directions: Proceed towards the public toilet. Go straight to the washing bay past the toilets. There is a small room that states "Store" for prayers.
5be66a13-02bf-4cd3-bfd9-9dc04fb61e50.name: Takashimaya at Ngee Ann City Tower A
5be66a13-02bf-4cd3-bfd9-9dc04fb61e50.provision: Slippers, Prayer Mat, Radio, Stool, Sarong, Fan
5be66a13-02bf-4cd3-bfd9-9dc04fb61e50.remarks: Strictly for staffs/tenants. Shared male and female toilet. Basins are located outside musolla.

7775c203-3ced-4e68-9393-e0670cf799cd.directions: From the lift, walk straight towards the white generators. Once in front, turn right
7775c203-3ced-4e68-9393-e0670cf799cd.name: United Square
7775c203-3ced-4e68-9393-e0670cf799cd.provision: Prayer Mat, Slippers, Al-Qur'an, Sarong, Telekung, Chair
7775c203-3ced-4e68-9393-e0670cf799cd.remarks: Shared male and female praying area. Nearest lift to musolla is located beside Efflorescence shop on level 1.

a03a7d82-bf7e-4fb6-967f-7ff0efacf21e.directions: Beside Texas Chicken at the Supreme Dining Area. Look for a small room (white door) which states 'Musholla'.
a03a7d82-bf7e-4fb6-967f-7ff0efacf21e.name: Gardens by the Bay

c0d55b2f-8d28-4b7b-8a9a-85584c20f730.name: Ba'alwie Mosque
c0d55b2f-8d28-4b7b-8a9a-85584c20f730.remarks: Built in 1952 by a prominent and well-respected imam from the Alatas family, this old generation masjid has served the needs of university undergraduates in Bukit Timah before the campus was relocated to Kent Ridge. Today, the one-storey masjid, which is located in the Central, can accommodate up to 400 worshippers for daily and Friday prayers. It is also crowded during Hari Raya prayers. On Thursday evenings, many Muslims gather for recitation of praises to Allah.

7a8fde24-443c-4a2e-a90d-8129d722db13.name: Jamiyah Ar-Rabitah Mosque
7a8fde24-443c-4a2e-a90d-8129d722db13.remarks: Redeveloped in 1985 on the same site as the old masjid, this three-storey cream structure can accommodate up to 2000 people. The first masjid was built in 1960. Today, the masjid in Central part of the island serves the needs of residents in Redhill, Tiong Bahru and Alexandra areas, besides the office workers at the nearby industrial estates. Besides madrasah and kindergarten classes, it organizes regular religious classes for the adults.

5a2c042c-1041-48f9-8cd7-cc0273c82534.directions: Go down the escalator beside QiJi to basement. Out the glass door, turn left and left again. Head to the extreme left of the carpark. Musolla is located near carpark ramp.
5a2c042c-1041-48f9-8cd7-cc0273c82534.name: Marina Square
5a2c042c-1041-48f9-8cd7-cc0273c82534.provision: Prayer Mat, Chair, Sarong, Tasbih, Songkok, Al-Quran, Telekung, Fan
5a2c042c-1041-48f9-8cd7-cc0273c82534.remarks: There is an ablution area near the musolla. Shared male and female praying area.

7b1cf79a-9fbd-465a-8f18-a3198fd92462.name: Singapore Institute of Management, Blk A

be641313-1f42-426e-8a09-fc9406eb99be.directions: YIH - Take A1 from Kent Ridge MRT. Alight at YIH bus stop. Climb the stairs towards Student Service Centre to level 3.
be641313-1f42-426e-8a09-fc9406eb99be.name: YIH, NUS

ab18c5d8-7c0f-48b3-b315-5994c1fc05ed.name: Mydin Mosque
ab18c5d8-7c0f-48b3-b315-5994c1fc05ed.remarks: This masjid was originally completed in 1935.  Located in the Eastern part of the island, it has been rebuilt in 2001 which increased its capacity to 1,000 people.  Built to serve the needs of the neighbourhood along Changi Road, its activities are mainly religious lectures.

388ecd6c-4b30-472e-be29-dfe01d64d72e.name: Alkaff Kampung Melayu Mosque
388ecd6c-4b30-472e-be29-dfe01d64d72e.remarks: It is one of the few masjids, which offer religious classes for the hearing-impaired and disabled. On Sunday mornings, hundreds of children dressed in their Muslim attire complete with headgear stroll into the mosque compounds to be part of the various religious classes. The masjid, which is located in the East, can fill up to 3,000 worshippers.  Built under the Mosque Building Fund in November 1994, it replaced the older generation mosque of the same name.

4fd40876-3207-4df6-8d50-27ce7d5725e7.directions: Utown - Take D1 from Kent Ridge MRT. Alight at UTown bus stop. Walk towards Education Resource Centre (ERC). Go to the 2nd floor. Go towards the exit/toilet. Enter the Exit door (stairs 3).
4fd40876-3207-4df6-8d50-27ce7d5725e7.name: Utown, NUS

5c64e639-29aa-49ab-a355-6482f7e2da53.name: Abdul Gafoor Mosque
5c64e639-29aa-49ab-a355-6482f7e2da53.remarks: Originally built in 1859, this masjid with its unique architecture has earned the distinction as  one of Singapore's national monuments. It has an unabashed mélange of styles – a mix of Southern Indian, Moghul and Europeans influences.  Located in the Central part of Singapore, it has since been redeveloped (re-opened in 1998) with a capacity of 3000 and offers madrasah classes in Tamil besides its usual religious classes.

50f6a8fa-2ce1-4178-8a9e-b0c0c482e8ac.directions: Go to the hotel lift lobby and go down to basement 2. Out the lift, exit right. Turn left and left again and walk straight to carpark no. 39 - 41.
50f6a8fa-2ce1-4178-8a9e-b0c0c482e8ac.name: Four Seasons Hotel
50f6a8fa-2ce1-4178-8a9e-b0c0c482e8ac.provision: Prayer Mat, Chair, Sejadah, Mirror, Sarong, Telekung, Al-Quran
50f6a8fa-2ce1-4178-8a9e-b0c0c482e8ac.remarks: There is also an ablution area near the musolla. Strictly for staffs/tenants. Male and female praying areas are segregated by a sliding curtain.

2a5f80ba-606f-40f5-a333-b6f34a223dd7.name: Mujahidin Mosque
2a5f80ba-606f-40f5-a333-b6f34a223dd7.remarks: This is the second satellite masjid built under the Mosque Building Fund. Completed in October 1977, it is conspicuous by its cream-coloured walls and circular glass-paneled prayer hall. Instead of a dome, it has a cuboid-shaped top with semi-oval openings on all four sides. The masjid in the Central part of the island which can fill up to 3,500 people offers madrasah and kindergarten classes as well as other religious classes on a regular basis.

759a6dff-291d-44df-82d4-bf6444475224.address: 5140 Ang Mo Kio Central Avenue 6, S(569844)
759a6dff-291d-44df-82d4-bf6444475224.name: Al-Muttaqin Mosque

0ca2524b-9518-460d-8ad3-9224629d9087.name: Khadijah Mosque
0ca2524b-9518-460d-8ad3-9224629d9087.remarks: Built in 1920, the masjid is currently being restored to its original splendour. Named after the wealthy lady who donated $50000 in 1916 to build this masjid, restoration works was completed in 2001. The masjid located in the Central part of Singapore has a current capacity of 500 people. Its activities include computer classes, training and youth programmes as well as tuition.

08a38300-4e71-4a65-9983-d15ab4d70321.name: Hasanah Mosque
08a38300-4e71-4a65-9983-d15ab4d70321.remarks: First built in 1971, this masjid was redeveloped in 1993 into a four-storey building complete with elevator. Its two levels of prayer hall can accommodate up to 2500 worshippers. Located in the West, it has Internet Corner, which for a nominal annual subscription of $5, members can surf the net for $2 an hour. A newly set up Youth Wing organizes recreational activities such as camping and soccer games for the young. Muslims can benefit from its imam and muezzin courses organized on an ad-hoc basis.

f10ff22f-6d02-44fb-b546-3664c3f770ea.name: Kassim Mosque
f10ff22f-6d02-44fb-b546-3664c3f770ea.remarks: Combining both modern and Islamic architecture, this spanking new masjid was rebuilt to replace an old one built way back in 1924. Completed in 1999, the four-storey masjid located in the East can accommodate up to 2000 people. It is linked to Wisma Indah, a wakaf complex which houses the masjid’s office, commercial offices. Besides organizing regular religious courses for adults, the masjid also provides Internet facilities for visitors.

dba10912-3bc1-4e7c-83b8-c04ee14b5f03.name: Al-Firdaus Mosque
dba10912-3bc1-4e7c-83b8-c04ee14b5f03.remarks: This old generation masjid located in the West, off Choa Chu Kang road, was built in 1962. In 1999, the masjid, which serves the needs of the nearby residents, was rebuilt. Today, it can accommodate up to 200 people.  There are religious classes for adults in the evening.

d681a099-d828-4055-b579-4162966da0a6.name: Sultan Mosque
d681a099-d828-4055-b579-4162966da0a6.remarks: Built during colonial times, this old generation masjid has been gazetted as a national monument. Built in 1824, it was one of the first few masjids to be built on the island. It was later rebuilt in 1920 by Swan and Maclaren who were responsible for Singapore’s other important landmarks. The masjid is a mix of Classical, Persian, Moorish and Turkish themes that form what is known as the Islamic Saracenic style. Located in the Central, it has a capacity of 2000 people and is one of the most frequented prayer venue.

eeb543e3-691f-4191-a845-4ceee1ad460d.name: Singapore Polytechnic, T21
eeb543e3-691f-4191-a845-4ceee1ad460d.remarks: Musolla is within view of the basement study corner.

fe1d3336-7de3-472c-99e0-7132f2707e24.directions: Central Forum FASS - Alight at the Central Library bus stop. Climb the stairs to the library. Turn to the right to the book drop. Go down the narrow stairs beside the book drop. The musolla is halfway between the 1st and 2nd floor.
fe1d3336-7de3-472c-99e0-7132f2707e24.name: Central Forum FASS, NUS

654fdd90-ee59-484d-b251-1d4258af7012.directions: Take the escalator to basement carpark and turn left at the exit
654fdd90-ee59-484d-b251-1d4258af7012.name: Jurong Point
654fdd90-ee59-484d-b251-1d4258af7012.remarks: Musolla is air-conditioned. If the musolla is locked, get the room key from the guard.

ab40d106-a9d5-44a1-96d7-98ddf0c32cf9.directions: Take the lift to level 4, turn left and enter stair A exit door. Go up to level 5 and turn left and proceed straight to the extreme end where the musolla is located. There are signs to lead to the location.
ab40d106-a9d5-44a1-96d7-98ddf0c32cf9.name: Lagun Sari at OCN Building

f5454fb2-ae3c-4ed0-8f72-16764ca98c19.name: Sheraton Towers
f5454fb2-ae3c-4ed0-8f72-16764ca98c19.directions: Take the lift lobby carpark down to B4. Exit the door to the carpark and go down the stairs. Prayer area is at the right corner of the carpark. There is a tap next to the area.

f41a5a8e-19ea-424b-9829-9dd89cbb9624.name: Al-Abrar Mosque
f41a5a8e-19ea-424b-9829-9dd89cbb9624.remarks: The masjid, which bears the imprint of South Indian architecture in its narrow frontages, which are defined by two minaret-style towers, was founded in 1827. But it was only in 1855, that a formal building was set up. In 1974, the old generation masjid located in Central Singapore was gazetted as one of the national monuments. With a capacity of 500, it serves the needs of office workers in the Shenton Road area. Unlike neighbourhood masjids, which spring to life in the evening, this masjid is relatively quiet except for its occasional Tafsir Al-Quran (Al-Quran interpretation) courses.

cb0c39a0-031d-4a5d-b942-5455616be7e1.name: Al-Islah Mosque
cb0c39a0-031d-4a5d-b942-5455616be7e1.remarks: Al-Islah Mosque is the second mosque built under Phase 4 of the Mosque Building Programme. With its capacity for 4,000 congregants, Al-Islah Mosque will be able to serve the growing Muslim community in Punggol and the surrounding neighbourhoods, as well as ease the prayer space crunch on Fridays and Eid for Muslims in the eastern part of Singapore.

e9498cf8-8f79-43b3-b72e-a53d36070da8.name: Alkaff Upper Serangoon Mosque
e9498cf8-8f79-43b3-b72e-a53d36070da8.remarks: This old generation masjid sited next to Darul Libanat, a girls’ orphanage, was built in 1920. The masjid located in the Central part of the island has undergone several renovation, its most recent one in 1998, in which the prayer hall was extended to accommodate a larger congregation of 2,500 people. It serves the religious needs of the small Muslim residents in the area as well as office workers. Besides daily and Friday prayer, there are religious classes held at the masjid.

c7c8e27a-324b-4a24-8431-b72cd5f31d27.name: Angullia Mosque
c7c8e27a-324b-4a24-8431-b72cd5f31d27.remarks: If there is one masjid, which attracts a wide range of nationalities, it must be the Masjid Angullia. Located along one of Singapore’s busiest main roads in the Central district, the mosque is a place for devotion of shoppers across the road at Serangoon Plaza as well as shopkeepers and office workers nearby. It can accommodate 400 Muslims any one time. Built with funds from a wealthy Angullia family in 1970, it has an Indian-like minaret. Today, it is famous as a center of tabligh (activities to promote Islam).

4342d920-ae35-4fc4-a9ff-6a0f45086511.name: An-Nahdhah Mosque
4342d920-ae35-4fc4-a9ff-6a0f45086511.remarks:
This mosque is the sixth one to be built under Phase III of the Mosque Building Fund programme to serve the needs of the Muslim community around the Bishan area. The mosque can accommodate about 4,000 people and was opened to the public on 6th January 2006. 

The mosque complex also houses MUIS's Harmony Centre where visitors could learn of the Muslim Community and Islam as practiced in multi-cultural Singapore. Being the first of its kind in a Singapore mosque, the 2-storey Harmony Centre showcases exhibits, artifacts and information on Islamic civilisation and lifestyle. Contemporary issues in Islam and Inter-faith understanding will also be a feature at the Centre through talks and activities. The Centre is scheduled to be opened to all in October 2006.

ea621d8f-488a-4269-8760-53a88bcd5929.name: Darul Makmur Mosque
ea621d8f-488a-4269-8760-53a88bcd5929.remarks: Morning is a hectic period at the masjid when doting parents wave their pre-schoolers goodbye. Besides kindergarten classes for these pre-schoolers, the mosque is among the few, which offers a Tahfiz (Al-Quran memorization) course for children. Built in 1989, it serves Muslim families living in Yishun and the North part of the island. The masjid, which falls under Phase Two of the Mosque Building Fund, can accommodate about 3000 people.

4955bc68-3a7b-42b2-9b62-af657a94f521.name: Haji Mohd Salleh (G) Mosque
4955bc68-3a7b-42b2-9b62-af657a94f521.remarks: A historic milestone was achieved in November 1999 when its new four-storey building was officially opened after more than a year of extensive rebuilding. The original structure which dated back in 1896 was built on land donated by an individual. The masjid with its simple and modern architecture can accommodate up to 1,500 congregants.

8aeeb089-46b3-4928-8801-16273f32ddaa.name: Haji Muhammad Salleh (P) Mosque
8aeeb089-46b3-4928-8801-16273f32ddaa.remarks: Sited at the far end of Shenton Road, the masjid in its tranquil serenity is a sharp contrast to the hustle and bustle of the busy Central Business District. With a total capacity of 500, this old generation masjid, which was built in 1903, underwent several renovation and repair works. Because it is located away from residential areas, activities are confined during office hours and constitute mainly the obligatory prayers.

4a8392f9-0ab5-4942-a817-b431d50de769.name: Hajjah Rahimabi Mosque
4a8392f9-0ab5-4942-a817-b431d50de769.remarks: Built from donation by Hajjah Rahima Bee Ahmad Angullia, this masjid was redeveloped from an existing masjid, which had been around since 1960. the redeveloped masjid, which was completed in 1984, was renamed after the donor. Located in the Central part of the island, it is one of the several mosques which have pulpits decorated with woodcarvings. With a capacity of about 500 worshippers, it organizes Iqra’ and Mukaddam (Quran reading) courses.

c376d55c-0b35-4668-9f8f-2b80e5dcf5aa.name: Hussein Sulaiman Mosque
c376d55c-0b35-4668-9f8f-2b80e5dcf5aa.remarks: This old generation masjid which started as a village surau was built way back in 1902. Today, it retains much of its original architecture. Located in the Central part of the island, it occupies an area of 422 sq metre and has a capacity of 300 people. Activities are confined to daily and Friday prayers with occasional religious lectures.

fc7a8932-4707-43fe-9a8e-6b0b59261e6a.name: Maarof Mosque
fc7a8932-4707-43fe-9a8e-6b0b59261e6a.remarks: Maarof Mosque is Singapore’s 25th satellite mosque to be funded by the Mosque Building and Mendaki Fund (MBMF). At full capacity, Masjid Maarof can accommodate approximately 4,500 worshippers.

067ecc8d-d1ea-4018-9f23-0bb60d8dd3d1.name: Yusof Ishak Mosque
067ecc8d-d1ea-4018-9f23-0bb60d8dd3d1.remarks: Masjid Yusof Ishak is the 71st mosque in Singapore today, and the fourth mosque built under Phase 4 [1] of the Mosque Building Programme. It is Singapore’s 26th mosque to be funded by the Mosque Building and Mendaki Fund (MBMF). Masjid Yusof Ishak is designed with a unique architecture blending traditional mosque characteristics with Nusantara heritage and elements, while also addressing functional requirements. Distinctive features of a tropical Nusantara house, such as eaves/overhangs, verandah, decorative fixed ventilation panels and beautifully crafted balustrades, are reinterpreted and expressed in a modern way befitting this new generation mosque.

9a0e5e8b-b39c-4379-a3ba-d8b914f6c205.address: Gertak Merah, Johor Bahru, Johor, Malaysia 80100
9a0e5e8b-b39c-4379-a3ba-d8b914f6c205.name: MASJID SULTAN ABU BAKAR
9a0e5e8b-b39c-4379-a3ba-d8b914f6c205.remarks:
Masjid Sultan Abu Bakar tersergam di atas sebuah bukit berhampiran bandar Johor Bahru dan mempunyai pemandangan indah Selat Johor dan Singapura. Masjid ini merupakan salah sebuah masjid lama yang tercantik di Malaysia.

Masjid Sultan Abu Bakar dibina pada 1 Muharam 1310 Hijri bersamaan 26 Julai 1892 Masihi, atas titah Sultan Abu Bakar. Ia terletak berhampiran pejabat Majlis Agama Islam dan Istana Besar Johor Bahru, iaitu di atas Bukit Kecil di Jalan Tun Dr. Ismail, mengadap Selat Tebrau, menjadikan ia antara bangunan yang mempunyai pemandangan yang indah di Johor Bahru.

Upacara perasmian masjid ini telah disempurnakan oleh Sultan Ibrahim (1895-1959) pada 1 Syawal 1317 bersamaan 2 Februari 1900 Masihi. Nama masjid ini diambil sempena nama Sultan Abu Bakar sendiri atau dikenali sebagai Bapa Johor Moden. Masjid ini boleh memuatkan seramai 2,000 orang jemaah pada satu-satu masa.
9a0e5e8b-b39c-4379-a3ba-d8b914f6c205.directions: Lokasi berdekatan dengan Jabatan Agama Negeri Johor

a8671d59-81ed-43c5-bcbc-6f22d25f8452.address: Taman Sri Tanjung, Muar, Johor, Malaysia 84000
a8671d59-81ed-43c5-bcbc-6f22d25f8452.name: MASJID SULTAN IBRAHIM
a8671d59-81ed-43c5-bcbc-6f22d25f8452.remarks:
Masjid Jamek Sultan Ibrahim ini siap didirikan sekitar tahun 1927 Masihi dan telah dirasmikan pada 28 Februari 1930 Masihi oleh Tengku Mahkota Ismail (Sultan Ismail) yang menjadi Pemangku Sultan Johor ketika itu. Ia didirikan bagi menggantikan bangunan kayu yang telah dibina pada tahun 1880-an.
Masjid ini terletak di Jalan Petri, Tanjung Emas, Muar yang berlatar belakang Sungai Muar. Pada masa dahulu kebanyakan penempatan didirikan berhampiran dengan aliran air yang menjadi laluan utama sebelum pembinaan jalan darat. Oleh itu, pembinaan masjid berdekatan sungai adalah penting.

c2e5392b-71a3-441f-b687-99581d12bfd7.name: MASJID SULTAN ISMAIL
c2e5392b-71a3-441f-b687-99581d12bfd7.provision: Masjid Sultan Ismail dilengkapi peralatan canggih seperti sistem pendingin dan audio visual. Ini membantu menaik taraf masjid ini dan ia merupakan antara masjid yang aktif dengan pelbagai program yang dilaksanakan oleh penduduk daripada pelbagai lapisan dan peringkat umur.

cb525be7-1c6d-4a8c-a428-43b3f89389ab.name: MASJID  BANDAR MERSING
cb525be7-1c6d-4a8c-a428-43b3f89389ab.remarks: Masjid Jamek Mersing terletak di Bandar Mersing ini telah didirikan pada 7 Syawal 1375 Hijri bersamaan 18 Mei 1956 Masihi. Upacara peletakan batu asas masjid ini kemudiannya telah disempurnakan oleh Datoâ€™ Syed Alwi, iaitu Mufti Kerajaan Negeri Johor ketika itu pada 24 Zulhijjah 1375 Hijri bersamaan 2 Ogos 1956 Masihi.

c08ac9ad-521c-4b85-b032-f2e95a4189b7.address: Kampung Sateh, 83000 Batu Pahat, Johor, Malaysia 83000
c08ac9ad-521c-4b85-b032-f2e95a4189b7.name: MASJID DATO' BENTARA LUAR
c08ac9ad-521c-4b85-b032-f2e95a4189b7.remarks: Masjid yang telah didirikan pada tahun 1930-an ini terletak di Jalan Masjid, Batu Pahat, iaitu berhadapan Stadium Batu Pahat. Masjid ini pernah dijadikan Masjid Daerah yang utama sebelum pembinaan masjid baru. Bangunan masjid ini masih kukuh dan digunakan sehingga kini.

25444663-e382-4bd2-858f-4ceba7cac6b4.name: MASJID SULTAN ISMAIL UTM
25444663-e382-4bd2-858f-4ceba7cac6b4.remarks:
Pembinaan Masjid Sultan Ismail bermula pada tahun 1986 dan telah siap pada tahun 1990 dengan belanja hampir RM 19 juta. Masjid ini telah dirasmikan oleh DYMM Sultan Iskandar Ibni Almarhum Sultan Ismail, Sultan Johor, pada 23 Ogos 1991.

Masjid Sultan Ismail terletak di Dataran Tinggi di tengah-tengah kampus. Kedudukan ini juga selaras dengan konsep pembelajaran Islam yang menjadikan masjid sebagai sumber memperoleh dan menyebarkan ilmu.Masjid Sultan Ismail boleh menampung jemaah lebih daripada 10,000 orang dalam satu-satu masa, termasuk 800 jemaah wanita di dewan solat wanita aras 3. Keluasan lantai keseluruhan Masjid Sultan Ismail adalah lebih kurang 100,000 kaki persegi. Keluasan lantai dewan solat utama adalah lebih kurang 100,000 kaki persegi. Keluasan lantai dewan solat utama adalah 41,000 kaki persegi.

3543c11e-170b-4b3c-8d8d-7637de547810.name: MASJID AL- IMAN
3543c11e-170b-4b3c-8d8d-7637de547810.remarks:
Selain nama Masjid Leban Chondong, ia turut dikenali dengan nama Masjid Al-Iman. Masjid ini terletak kira-kira 12 km dari Bandar Rompin. Masjid ini didirikan pada tahun 1984 Masihi dengan pembiayaannya ditanggung oleh Kerajaan Negeri Pahang di bawah program Amanah Saham Pahang Berhad (ASPA).
Masjid ini telah dirasmikan oleh Tengku Mahkota Pahang. Masjid-masjid baru di Pahang yang terletak di bawah program ASPA dibina berkonsepkan tempatan, iaitu diperbuat daripada kayu dan bercirikan bumbung berbentuk piramid serta tiada pembaziran ruang atau hiasan berlebihan.

7da414b1-b44d-4e12-8673-b7528732d1b2.name: MASJID KARIAH AMAR PENGHULU
7da414b1-b44d-4e12-8673-b7528732d1b2.remarks: awal pembinaan dari kayu. dari masa ke semasa dibaik pulih dengan batu dan simen. 1987 dibaik pulih dengan lebih baik. awal tahun 2008 bangunan dibaik pulih dan di naik taraf.
7da414b1-b44d-4e12-8673-b7528732d1b2.directions: terletak di tepi jalan utama menghala jelebu - seremban. berhampiran dengan taman rekreasi jeram toi.

bb20aeae-9f98-4271-a141-3fd071bbd8d7.name: MASJID ABIDIN (KERAJAAN)
bb20aeae-9f98-4271-a141-3fd071bbd8d7.remarks:
Sebagai sebuah negeri Islam, maka masjid adalah suatu simbol agama yang dipandang mulia dan suci, selain daripada menjadikan tempat untuk beramal ibadat. Negeri Terengganu Darul Iman berasa bangga dengan adanya sebuah masjid bersejarah yang sekarang dikenali dengan nama Masjid Abidin yang tersergam dan terletak di tengah-tengah bandar Kuala Terengganu. Dahulunya masjid ini dikenali dengan nama Masjid Besar atau Masjid Puteh.

Bangunan masjid ini pada asalnya merupakan sebuah istana kayu yang didirikan oleh Al-Marhum Sultan Zainal Abidin II (Marhum Masjid 1793-1808) kemudian dalam tahun 1269H/1852M, Almarhum Baginda (Sultan Umar) telah mendirikan bangunan baru daripada batu. Bangunan masjid ini telah diperbesarkan semasa pemerintahan Almarhum Sultan Zainal Abidin III, kira-kira dalam tahun 1319H (1901M).

Menurut cerita, masjid ini pada mulanya didirikan tanpa tiang di tengah-tengah bahagian dalam bangunan. Dindingnya hanya sekerat dan melengkung berlubang-lubang bagaikan pintu gerbang. Terdapat sebuah binaan kayu yang beratapkan kayu berlian. Terdapat juga enam buah kolah pada masa itu dan setiap satunya berukuran kira-kira dua depa panjang dan 1.5 depa lebar.

Semasa pemerintahan Almarhum Sultan Zainal Abidin III, barulah binaan itu dibaiki dan diperbesar seperti mana yang ada sekarang (sebelum tambahan baru) dengan ditambah tiang-tiang di ruang tengah bahagian dalam, dinding tembok simen, diadakan sutuh dan tiga buah menara. Pembinaannya pada masa itu dikelolakan oleh Tengku Muda Kemaman (Tengku Panglima Besar), dan tukangnya pula terdiri daripada orang-orang Melayu dan juga Cina. Tulisan-tulisan kasar yang terdapat di pintu masuk utama telah ditulis oleh Tengku Abdul Kadir bin Salim, manakala lukisan-lukisan kecil pula dilukis oleh Tuan Haji Abdul Rahman.

Mimbar yang ada sekarang dibuat oleh Encik Badul Kadir. Semasa pemerintahan Duli Yang Maha Mulia Almarhum Sultan Ismail Nasiruddin Shah, perubahan besar telah dibuat dengan tambahan baru yang hampir sekali ganda luasnya dari bangunan asal dan penambahan alat-alat baru. Selain daripada tempat untuk beribadat, masjid ini juga digunakan untuk pelbagai aktiviti-aktiviti keagamaan.

864dddb2-baf1-4824-b15a-2160f433eaec.name: MASJID NEGERI
864dddb2-baf1-4824-b15a-2160f433eaec.remarks:
Telah dibina pada tahun 1966M dan diasaskan oleh Kerajaan Negeri Sembilan di atas tapak yang telah dikurniakan oleh Kerajaan Negeri. Memandangkan bahawa Negeri sembilan pada masa itu belum mempunyai masjid negeri, maka Kerajaan Negeri sembilan di bawah pempinan YAB Tan Sri Dr. Mohd Said bin Muhammad Menteri Besar Negeri Sembilan ketika itu telah bersetuju supaya masjid Negeri dibina dikawasan seluas lebih kurang 2 hektar yang ada sekarang bagi menggantikan Masjid Jamek Bandar Seremban yang tidak dapat menampung para jemaah yang semakin bertambah.    

Ia telah dirasmikan oleh Paduka Seri Tuanku yang DiPertuan Besar Negeri Sembilan pada hari jumaat, 24 November 1967.
864dddb2-baf1-4824-b15a-2160f433eaec.provision: Masjid ini dilengkapi dengan perpustakaan awam  bilik kuliah dan bilik ICT
864dddb2-baf1-4824-b15a-2160f433eaec.directions: Terletak di tengah-tengah pusat bandar Seremban yang berdekatan dengan Lake Garden serta pejabat kerajaan yang lain.

f56e1212-76c6-40f3-99d0-15691b264bb5.name: MASJID KARIAH KAMPUNG BATU SERAMBAI
f56e1212-76c6-40f3-99d0-15691b264bb5.remarks: DIBINA PADA TAHUN 1968 DIATAS SEBIDANG TANAH YANG DIWAKAFKAN OLEH PN. HJH JENIAH BT. HJ ABD HAMID.Masjid ini pernah dibaiki dan dibaik pulih pada tahun 1992,1993 dan 2000.
f56e1212-76c6-40f3-99d0-15691b264bb5.provision: ruang solat,bilik air lelaki dan perempuan,tempat wudhuk ,bilik imam
f56e1212-76c6-40f3-99d0-15691b264bb5.directions: Terletak di tepi jalan utama jelebu - seremban. berhampiran dengan sungai.

ff1bc39c-9f44-4f77-946c-03950c80f401.name: MASJID KARIAH KUALA DULANG
ff1bc39c-9f44-4f77-946c-03950c80f401.remarks: dibina pada kurun ke-16, hanya sebuah bangsal dan dijadikan tempat solat berjemaah dan mengislamkan penduduk setempat , berkembang menjadi masjid kariah Kuala Dulang dan adat Luak Jelebu
ff1bc39c-9f44-4f77-946c-03950c80f401.directions: diantara bangunan bersejarah didaerah jelebu.terletak di kawasan kampung.Ahli qaryah terdiri dari kampung kuala dulang,peninjau,sarin,kg bukit,ulu jelebu dan byak kawasan perkampungan kecil.

03760690-66fc-4217-b79a-6150b2f0dde1.address: N132, 71600 Ulu Triang, Negeri Sembilan, Malaysia 71600
03760690-66fc-4217-b79a-6150b2f0dde1.name: MASJID KARIAH KAMPUNG TERIANG
03760690-66fc-4217-b79a-6150b2f0dde1.remarks: dibina oleh beberapa orang kampung secara bergotong-royong. Merupakan bangunan kayu 6 batang tiang, berdinding papan dan beratap rumbia.
03760690-66fc-4217-b79a-6150b2f0dde1.directions: terletak ditepi jalan menuju ke kampung Gagu.berdekatan dengan pekan kuala klawang.

91f93cde-d1ee-4273-883c-8f6aaa4f8be3.name: MASJID KARIAH KG. CHENNAH
91f93cde-d1ee-4273-883c-8f6aaa4f8be3.remarks: pengasasnya adalah Dato' Muda Kenaboi dan ahli-ahli kariah. semasa dibina ahli jemaah seramai 87 orang. Masjid telah dibaiki dan dibesrkan pada tahun 2005. Pada masa ini ahli jemaah pada tahun 2005. Pada masa ini ahli jemaah telah bertambah seramai 122 orang. Tapak masjid telah diwakafkan  oleh kerajaan negeri.
91f93cde-d1ee-4273-883c-8f6aaa4f8be3.directions: berhampiran dengan pekan chennah,air terjun jeram gading serta pusat pemantapan akidah jelebu

0ce8e21a-90b3-49f1-93c4-dfea14f49070.name: MASJID KARIAH KG. PUOM
0ce8e21a-90b3-49f1-93c4-dfea14f49070.remarks: Berusia 25 tahun. Dahulu Masjid Kg.Puom hanyalah berdinding kayu dan hanya mampu memuatkan 60 orang jemaah. Selepas kerajaan negeri memberi peruntukan masjid Kg.Puom telah diubah suai dan boleh memuatkan 160 orang jemaah.

34936cbf-c1a2-4e06-862e-5157e449a911.name: MASJID KARIAH SERI PURNAMA PETASEH
34936cbf-c1a2-4e06-862e-5157e449a911.remarks: Bangunan Masjid di atas bukit, ditepi jalan dari Kuala Klawang menghala ke Simpang Pertang.Telah dibina pada tahun 1963.Diasaskan oleh Allahyarham Haji Aminuddin bin Manaf,Allahyarham tuan haji  lasim ibrahim dan tuan haji mahmod abdul malek.Masjid ini telah didirikan  di tapak seluas 1/2 ekar yang diwakafkan oleh Encik Ramli bin Mola.Masjid ini telah dibaiki dan dinaiktaraf pada tahun 2005 dan 2006.
34936cbf-c1a2-4e06-862e-5157e449a911.directions: Bangunan Masjid di atas bukit, ditepi jalan dari Kuala Klawang menghala ke Simpang Pertang

a465cf1e-ffbe-4337-b3f6-7e8f3e313c46.name: MASJID JAMEK BANDAR SEREMBAN
a465cf1e-ffbe-4337-b3f6-7e8f3e313c46.remarks:
BERALAMAT DI JALAN TUN DR ISMAIL 70200 SEREMBAN. MASJID INI TELAH DIBAIKI DAN DIBESARKAN PADA TAHUN 1900. MASJID JAMEK BANDAR SEREMBAN TELAH DIBINA PADA TAHUN 1900M DAN DIASASKAN OLEH KERAJAAN NNEGERI SEMBILAN.  

TAPAK MASJID INI TELAH WAKAFKAN OLEH YM DATO' BANDAR HJ AHMAD BIN ALI DAN KELUARGA SHEIKH ABDUL KADER. KERAJAAN NEGERI SEMBILAN DIBAWAH PIMPINAN YAB DATO' SERI UTAMA TAN SRI HJ MOHD ISA BIN DATO' HJ ABDUL SAMAD TELAH BERSETUJU BAHAWA MASJID LAMA YANG DIBINA PADA TAHUN  1900 YANG SUDAH UZUR ITU DIGANTIKAN DENGAN SEBUAH MASJID BARU YANG ADA SEKARANG INI.

WALAUBAGAIMANAPUN, MENARA MASJID INI YANG TELAH DIBINA PADA TAHUN 1924M MASIH DIKEKALKAN. SEMASA DIBINA AHLI JEMAAH ADALAH SERAMAI 1000 ORANG DAN KINI AHLI JEMAAH TELAH MENCAPAI JUMLAH SERAMAI 2000 ORANG.

MASJID INI MENGURUS 8 BUAH SURAU DI BAWAH SELIAANNYA.

22c6c01c-47e0-462e-837f-b90acfca1374.address: Tasik Perdana, Kuala Lumpur, Wilayah Persekutuan, Malaysia 50480
22c6c01c-47e0-462e-837f-b90acfca1374.name: MASJID NEGARA
22c6c01c-47e0-462e-837f-b90acfca1374.remarks:
Masjid Negara dibina sebagai tanda kesyukuran pemimpin dan rakyat atas kemerdekaan Tanah Melayu yang telah dicapai tanpa peperangan. Pembinaan masjid ini adalah atas cadangan Almarhum YTM Tunku Abdul Rahman Putra Al-Haj, Perdana Menteri Malaysia yang pertama. Ia menjadi lambang semangat perpaduan dan toleransi rakyat kerana melibatkan semua kaum pada ketika itu. Ini kerana selain daripada peruntukan wang kerajaan, kos pembiayaan membina Masjid Negara disumbangkan oleh rakyat jelata tanpa mengira kaum, agama dan bangsa. Nama masjid ini telah diberikan oleh YTM Tunku Abdul Rahman. Beliau tidak bersetuju masjid ini dinamakan dengan nama beliau seperti yang telah dicadangkan oleh banyak pihak.

Masjid Negara telah siap dibina pada 27 Ogos 1965 dan menjadi lambang keagongan Islam di Malaysia. Ia boleh menampung seramai 15,000 jemaah.
22c6c01c-47e0-462e-837f-b90acfca1374.provision:
Ruang anjung dan serambi yang luas di masjid ini dapat menampung kebanjiran para jemaah pada masa solat Jumaat dan solat hari raya. Selain itu ia turut digunakan untuk acara-acara lain seperti pameran majlis berbuka puasa dan sebagainya. Terdapat juga kemudahan lain di masjid ini seperti bangunan pentadbiran, perpustakaan, pejabat imam dan bilal, bilik orang kenamaan, dewan syarahan dan juga Makam Pahlawan.

Mendekati konsep seni bina Islam, Masjid Negara turut dilengkapi dengan pokok-pokok hijau dan beberapa kolam air dan air pancutan yang bertujuan mengimbangi udara di persekitaran dan mengindahkan kawasan masjid.

Fungsi masjid tidak bertumpu kepada ibadah solat semata-mata. Kegiatan-kegiatan lain seperti pendidikan, ceramah dan muzakarah diadakan untuk semua lapisan masyarakat. Menurut pegawai masjid ini ada antara mereka yang pernah melawat masjid ini mendapat hidayah daripada Allah lalu memeluk Islam setelah teruja dengan keindahannya.
22c6c01c-47e0-462e-837f-b90acfca1374.directions: Masjid Negara ini dibina di atas sebidang tanah berkeluasan 5.46 hektar. Kedudukannya bertentangan dengan stesen keretapi Kuala Lumpur. Berhampiran dengan bangunan ini juga, terdiri Kompleks Pusat Islam dan Muzium Kesenian Islam. Lokasinya sangat strategik dilengkapi dengan berbagai-bagai kemudahan dan berdekatan pula dengan stesen pengangkutan awam.

412f342e-21a6-4174-979a-f3c921a996d6.name: MASJID DIRAJA SULTAN ALAEDDIN
412f342e-21a6-4174-979a-f3c921a996d6.remarks: Dibina oleh Almarhum Sultan Sulaiman Ala'eddin Shah berhampiran istana baginda bersemayam.
412f342e-21a6-4174-979a-f3c921a996d6.directions: Ia terletak di mukim Bandar, Jugra dalam daerah Kuala Langat.

102ab8aa-6d3e-4db2-93c8-6af64298577b.address: Pusat Bandaraya, Kuala Lumpur, Wilayah Persekutuan, Malaysia 50000
102ab8aa-6d3e-4db2-93c8-6af64298577b.name: MASJID JAMEK sultan Abdul samad
102ab8aa-6d3e-4db2-93c8-6af64298577b.remarks:
Masjid Jamek ini terletak di Jalan Tun Perak, Kuala Lumpur. Ia telah dibuka dengan rasminya oleh Sultan Selangor, Sultan Alauddin Sulaiman Shah. Masjid yang tertua di Wilayah Persekutuan ini mendapat tumpuan orang ramai di sekitar pusat bandar. Sejak tahun 1979 Masihi, kerja-kerja pemulihan dan pembesarannya telah dijalankan sehingga 10 Mei 1983 Masihi yang melibatkan pembesaran masjid ke peringkat optimum tanpa mengubah reka bentuk asalnya.

Pembinaan masjid ini hanya mengambil masa selama sembilan bulan dan kosnya telah dibiayai oleh kerajaan dan sumbangan orang ramai. Memandangkan ia menjadi tumpuan ramai, beberapa tahun kemudian pihak kerajaan telah membesarkan ruang masjid ini serta dilengkapi dengan permaidani dan lampu-lampu hiasan. Kerja-kerja pembesaran masjid ini dilakukan pada tahun 1979 Masihi. Kemudian sekali lagi masjid ini diperbaiki pada tahun 1993 Masihi akibat keruntuhan salah sebuah kubahnya. Pada tanggal 23 jun 2017 dengan rasminya masjid ini telah ditukarkan nama dengan nama baru iaitu masjid jamek sultan abdul samad kuala lumpur yang telah dimashurkan oleh kebawah duli yang maha mulia tuanku syarifuddin SHAH ibni almarhum sultan abdul aziz shah sultan selangor.
Reka
102ab8aa-6d3e-4db2-93c8-6af64298577b.provision:
1. tEMPAT WUDUK YANG BERSIH DAN TANDAS YANG SELESA.  
2. GALERI YANG MENEMPATKAN GAMBAR-GAMBAR DAN BERITA MENGENAI MASJID SULTAN ABDUL SAMAD.
3. BERDEKATAN DENGAN PERHENTIAN LRT DAN DATARAN MERDEKA. 
4. MEMPUNYAI JAMBATAN YANG MERENTASI SUNGAI GOMBAK DARI MASJID KE DATARAN MERDEKA.
102ab8aa-6d3e-4db2-93c8-6af64298577b.directions: DI TENGAH-TENGAH BANDAR KUALA LUMPUR DAN BERDEKATAN DENGAN DATARAN MERDEKA.

95304afb-48bb-46a0-bb67-bf583f6404cd.name: MASJID DIRAJA TUANKU MUNAWIR
95304afb-48bb-46a0-bb67-bf583f6404cd.remarks: Masjid asal di Tanjung Beringin di bina pada tahun 1885M di atas tanah yang diwakafkan oleh Yam Tuan Tuanku Muhammad Shah.Bangunan baru dibangunkan pada tahun 1964M.

f8fdb4a0-fdfb-4148-8e1e-71f27f845949.name: MASJID JAMEK YAM TUAN RADEN
f8fdb4a0-fdfb-4148-8e1e-71f27f845949.remarks: Masjid asal dibina oleh Tok Muar secara gotong-royong bangunan kayu di tepi Sg Muar, memandangkan penduduk makin bertambah maka di pindahkan ke tempat sekarang dengan perbelanjaan kerajaan dan derma orang ramai.

b1996f17-67fb-4fdd-a2eb-248f07406986.address: Kompleks Kerajaan, Kuala Lumpur, Wilayah Persekutuan, Malaysia 50480
b1996f17-67fb-4fdd-a2eb-248f07406986.name: MASJID WILAYAH PERSEKUTUAN
b1996f17-67fb-4fdd-a2eb-248f07406986.remarks:
Pembinaan Masjid Wilayah ini direalisasikan pada 25 Syawal 1416 Hijri bersamaan 15 Mac 1996 Masihi dan siap dibina pada 30 Ogos 2000 Masihi. Upacara serah milik kepada pihak Jabatan Agama Islam Wilayah (JAWI) pada September 2000 Masihi.
Masjid Wilayah Persekutuan terletak di sebuah kawasan berbukit Jalan Duta, berhampiran susur masuk ke pusat bandaraya Kuala Lumpur. Tapak binaannya berkeluasan kira-kira 13.4 hektar, iaitu di atas tapak bekas mahkamah dan pejabat kerajaan. Cadangan pembangunan Masjid Wilayah ini diilhamkan oleh Tun Dr. Mahathir ketika menjadi Perdana Menteri keempat. Ia merupakan projek Jabatan Agama Islam Wilayah Persekutuan Kuala Lumpur (JAWI) dan diiktiraf berstatus Masjid Negeri.
b1996f17-67fb-4fdd-a2eb-248f07406986.provision: Masjid Wilayah ini dilengkapi dengan sekolah pendidikan Islam. Asrama, perpustakaan dan kemudahan bilik komputer turut disediakan. Selain kegiatan pembelajaran, aktiviti yang dilaksanakan ialah sambutan hari kebesaran Islam, ceramah, mesyuarat dan aktiviti kemasyarakatan yang disertai oleh semua golongan umat Islam. Masjid Wilayah ini menjadi antara tempat kunjungan wajib para pelancong dari dalam dan luar negara.

131e6c32-09a4-49c4-97a8-40293fd0404e.address: Kampung Bukit Changgang, Banting, Selangor, Malaysia 42700
131e6c32-09a4-49c4-97a8-40293fd0404e.name: MASJID AS SOBIRIN
131e6c32-09a4-49c4-97a8-40293fd0404e.remarks: MASJID PERTAMA DIBINA DI KG.BUKIT CHANGGANG TERLETAK DI KAWASAN KUBUR (TANAH WAKAF). PADA TAHUN 1950, MASJID BARU DIBINA HASIL USAHA ORANG RAMAI DI TANAH WAKAF HJ. MUSA (1EKAR). TAHUN 1964, KELUASAN MASJID DITAMBAH HASIL SUMBANGAN KERAJAAN.
131e6c32-09a4-49c4-97a8-40293fd0404e.provision: Antara kemudahan yang terdapat ialah  ruang parkir yang sederhana  luas,  van jenazah,  ruangan solat yang selesa untuk sembahyang, alat penghawa dingin dan  kolah untuk wuduk .
131e6c32-09a4-49c4-97a8-40293fd0404e.directions: Masjid ini terletak di sebelah Sekolah Agama dan dipersimpangan tiga Jalan Dengkil ke Banting dan juga Banting ke KLIA.

6f3ce4ce-829d-41ce-aac6-9873333c5a19.name: MASJID KARIAH BAGAN PINANG
6f3ce4ce-829d-41ce-aac6-9873333c5a19.remarks: Telah diasaskan oleh Ahli Jawatankuasa Masjid tersebut pada tahun 1986M. Pada masa pembinaan Masjid tersebut ahli jemaah pada masa itu seramai 200 orang sahaja. Masjid ini telah dibaiki dan dibesarkan pada tahun 1993 dan 1995M dan 2008M. Tapak Masjid ini telah diwakafkan oleh kerajaan. Sebelum ini, ahli kariah tersebut bersembahyang di tapak Masjid lama yang diwakafkan oleh Al-Marhum Dato' Penghulu Mohd Ali. Sekarang masjid ini boleh menampung seramai 2000 orang. Masjid ini pernah menjadi johan dalam Anugerah Masjid Contoh Peringkat daerah  dan Negeri bagi tahun 2007M.

0e03f68e-5861-430a-9c70-685dba539287.name: MASJID KARIAH TELOK KEMANG
0e03f68e-5861-430a-9c70-685dba539287.remarks:
Masjid Qaryah Telok Kemang telah dibina pada tahun 1994M dan diasaskan oleh Allahyarham YB Encik Mustafa bin Manaf. Tapak masjid ini telah dikurniakan oleh kerajaan negeri.

Masjid ini boleh menampung ahli jemaah seramai 1000 orang pada masa kini.

Masjid ini pernah dibaiki dan dinaiktaraf pada tahun 2004m dan 2009M.

Masjid ini menguruskan dan mengawal selia sebuah kawasan tanah perkuburan dan enam buah surau.

Masjid ini juga pernah memenangi tempat ketiga Anugerah Masjid Contoh Peringkat Daerah

Pengasas penubuhan Masjid kariah ini adalah En. Mustafa b. Manaf. Tapak masjid ini telah diwakafkan oleh kerajaan. Sebelum ini, ahli kariah bersembahyang di Masjid Lama Telok Kemang yang dibina pada tahun 1948.

842c44f9-20dd-43e6-a04f-e85d7c31c2dd.name: MASJID AL MUTTAQIN
842c44f9-20dd-43e6-a04f-e85d7c31c2dd.remarks: Masjid tertua di negeri selangor.Sebelum ibu negeri selangor berpindah ke klang, masjid ini merupakan tempat bersemayan sultan selangor, selain daripada masjid sultan alaiddin kg bandar.ahli kariah masjid sultan abd samad kg seri jugra merupakan jemaah masjid ini sebelum pembinaannya pada tahun 1986.makam al-marhum sultan abd samad berada berdekatan dengan masjid ini.
842c44f9-20dd-43e6-a04f-e85d7c31c2dd.provision: Antara kemudahan yang terdapat ialah  ruang parkir ,  van jenazah dan urusan jenazah,  ruangan solat yang selesa untuk sembahyang,  tempat  wuduk dan bilik mesyuarat.
842c44f9-20dd-43e6-a04f-e85d7c31c2dd.directions: Masjid ini terletak di kawasan perkampongan Kampong Permatang Pasir, Jugra.

c0783db7-71b4-4f3c-bb3a-31b84f8619f9.remarks: BANGUNAN ASAL MASJID KG JENJAROM TELAH DIBINA SECARA GOTONG ROYONG PADA TAHUN 1933 DI HALAMAN MASJID AL-FALAH YANG ADA SEKARANG DI LOT 2199 SELUAS 2.5 EKAR > masjid ini sedang dalam pembinaan.

b6490a17-80ae-4b1f-8f5d-613433ea7500.name: MASJID AL- MUKTAFI BILLAH SHAH
b6490a17-80ae-4b1f-8f5d-613433ea7500.remarks: Masjid Al-Muktafi Billah Shah telah dibina pada 2 Mei 1981 Masihi dan siap sepenuhnya pada 2 November 1984 Masihi. Peletakan batu asas masjid ini telah dilakukan oleh Yang Berhormat Mulia Tengku Razaleigh Hamzah yang menjadi Menteri Kewangan ketika itu pada awal bulan Julai 1978 Masihi. Tapak Masjid Al-Muktafi Billah Shah ini pada asalnya ialah tapak dewan orang ramai dan juga tanah perkuburan Hospital Kuala Terengganu.
